channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Does the US have a ‘K-shaped’ economy?
The tightrope of trust: How Modi and Putin have maintained a solid friendship since 2014
China's condom conundrum: If you can't afford a taxed contraceptive, can you afford to raise a child?
Why Trump’s MRI tests and ‘healthy’ diagnosis raise more questions about his fitness
Did Pakistan send expired goods to Sri Lanka as flood relief?
After success of Russia’s S-400 in Op Sindoor, why India wants its more advanced version
When machines become partners: The new normal of AI intimacy
item.description: What started as a digital niche concern has become a worldwide trend that is redefining relationships, ethics and even the composition of emotional life.

item.title: Putin’s upcoming Delhi visit: A renewed push towards a multipolar world amid turbulent times
item.description: India-Russia bilateral relations are geared towards establishing a stable and predictable multipolar and just world order founded on the sovereign equality of all states

item.title: Pakistan’s nightmare: How Chabahar is becoming India’s strategic bridge to Afghanistan
item.description: Afghanistan is no longer willing to live in Pakistan’s shadow, and India’s years of investment in Iran’s Chabahar port are finally paying off

item.title: Munir’s iron grip, Khan’s death rumours push Pakistan towards a dangerous juncture
item.description: Imran Khan has repeatedly accused General Asim Munir of being the ‘most oppressive dictator’ in the country’s history and of orchestrating a vindictive political crackdown. Rumours about Khan’s death have further deepened Pakistan’s political polarisation, pushing the country to a critical juncture

item.title: Putin in Delhi: How the India-Russia reset could reshape global geopolitics
item.description: The India-Russia relationship today isn’t simply a replay of the Soviet-era script. It is leaner, less sentimental and far more transactional and also sturdier than most expected.

item.title: Washington attack: Why Pakistan will want Trump to get entangled in Afghanistan
item.description: To stop the cycle of events along the Afghanistan border, Pakistan needs a heavy hand with powerful leverage. The United States fits the bill
